summary: This is an email correspondence from an attorney to Judge Nathan regarding a motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the case United States v. Maxwell. The motion and exhibits are submitted under temporary seal.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Addressed in the email regarding the motion to quash in US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Chambers
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing the motion to quash and exhibits.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case US v. Maxwell, whose Rule 17(c) subpoena is the subject of the motion to quash.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case US v. Maxwell.

events.title: Motion to Quash Filed
events.description: An attorney files a motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena issued to the defendant Ghislaine Maxwell and submits it under temporary seal.

keyFacts: A motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena was filed in the case United States v. Maxwell.
The motion and its exhibits were submitted under temporary seal on November 20, 2021.
The correspondence is directed to Judge Nathan's chambers in New York.
